description: Number of ways to transform say (((((((ab)c)d)e)f)g)h) to (a(b(c(d(e(f(gh))))))) where there are n multiplications (hence n+1 variables) by repeatedly applying the one-way associative law ((xy)z) -> (x(yz)).
comments: Number of maximal chains in the Tamari lattice T_n.  For n=3 there are 2 maximal chains in the Tamari lattice T3, whose Hasse diagram is a pentagon. - _F. Chapoton_, Mar 15 2013
references: D. E. Knuth, The Art of Computer Programming, Vol. 4, Section 7.2.1.6, see solution to Exercise 34. [_N. J. A. Sloane_, Jul 31 2011]
links: Alois P. Heinz, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..16
author: _Don Knuth_, Dec 11 1999
extensions: a(9)-a(14),a(15) from _Alois P. Heinz_, Mar 17 2013, Mar 27 2013
